dialogue_turns.speaker: People think an assassination attempt always helps a candidate, but actually it can totally backfire.
dialogue_turns.text: People think an assassination attempt always helps a candidate, but actually it can totally backfire.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think an assassination attempt always helps a candidate, but actually it can totally backfire.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Taiwan's 2004 election is a perfect example of that. President Chen Shui-bian was shot the day before the vote.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Taiwan's two thousand four election is a perfect example of that. President Chen Shui-bian was shot the day before the vote.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During its 2004 presidential election, polls showed then-President Chen Shui-bian trailing his opponent, Nationalist Party (Kuomintang) candidate Lien Chan. But this changed abruptly the day before the vote, when Chen and Vice President Annette Lu were shot during an election rally.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he ended up losing by a landslide margin of 25 percent, which is just huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he ended up losing by a landslide margin of twenty five percent, which is just huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The next day, Chen won the election by a razor-thin margin of 0.25%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and the sympathy wave people expected just didn't materialize—in fact, it seemed to work against him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and the sympathy wave people expected just didn't materialize-in fact, it seemed to work against him.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given this unexpected and narrow victory, it is widely believed that the assassination attempt swung the election in Chens favor.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there was that investigation by Henry Lee, the forensic expert, which got really messy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there was that investigation by Henry Lee, the forensic expert, which got really messy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he confirmed the injuries were real from an explosion, but then there was all this suspicion about the bomb's origin.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he confirmed the injuries were real from an explosion, but then there was all this suspicion about the bomb's origin.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While a subsequent investigation by the Chinese-American forensic expert Henry Lee confirmed that Chens abdominal injury was caused by a gunshot, an examination of the bullet found in Chens clothing suggested that the gun had been altered, with the bullet designed to have a weak impact.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which Taiwanese authorities kind of ignored, right? They just focused on the fact it was a real attack.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which Taiwanese authorities kind of ignored, right? They just focused on the fact it was a real attack.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taiwanese authorities cited Lees investigation as evidence that Chen and Lu were hit by real gunshots but ignored his finding about the weak bullet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then critics said it was staged to help Chen, even though the evidence didn't really support that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then critics said it was staged to help Chen, even though the evidence didn't really support that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, those who believed that the assassination attempt was staged viewed Lees conclusion as confirmation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So now with the Trump shooting, you've gotta wonder if we're seeing something similar play out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So now with the Trump shooting, you've gotta wonder if we're seeing something similar play out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, the shooter's been identified as a registered Democrat, but like, injured no one? It's already fueling conspiracy theories everywhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, the shooter's been identified as a registered Democrat, but like, injured no one? It's already fueling conspiracy theories everywhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While some details are still foggy, the shooter has been identified as a 20-year-old registered Republican who, armed with an AR-15-style rifle, killed one bystander and seriously injured two others before being killed by a Secret Service sniper.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And social media's just flooded with claims—Russia, Al Qaeda, you name it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And social media's just flooded with claims-Russia, Al Qaeda, you name it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Immediately after the shooting, social media platforms were inundated with conspiracy theories claiming the shooter was working for the Democratic Party, China, Hamas, or illegal immigrants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But here's the thing—Chen was leading in polls before he got shot, and then he lost. Trump was already trailing Biden in most polls.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But here's the thing-Chen was leading in polls before he got shot, and then he lost. Trump was already trailing Biden in most polls.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During its 2004 presidential election, polls showed then-President Chen Shui-bian trailing his opponent, Nationalist Party (Kuomintang) candidate Lien Chan. It is difficult to imagine the Chen Shui-bian effect not working in Trumps favor, especially since Trump was already leading Biden in most polls, both nationally and in many battleground states.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So if there's a "Chen Shui-bian effect," it could really hurt Trump even more, especially with voters blaming him for political violence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So if there's a Chen Shui-bian effect, it could really hurt Trump even more, especially with voters blaming him for political violence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But it is more likely that the shooting will benefit Trump. The tendency of many voters to cast sympathy votes suggests they may prioritize issues they find easier to understand over complex ones that may prove more consequential in the long run.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then you've got these simple narratives taking over—"Biden is too old" versus "Trump took a bullet."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then you've got these simple narratives taking over-Biden is too old versus Trump took a bullet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While Biden is too old is simple and straightforward, and Trump took a bullet for us is easy to understand, Trump and Bidens tariffs are bad for American households and firms is a more nuanced argument that requires some understanding of economic policy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Whereas complex stuff, like economic policy, just doesn't cut through the noise as easily.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whereas complex stuff, like economic policy, just doesn't cut through the noise as easily.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While Biden is too old is simple and straightforward, and Trump took a bullet for us is easy to understand, Trump and Bidens tariffs are bad for American households and firms is a more nuanced argument that requires some understanding of economic policy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It feels like unless something dramatic changes, this shooting might actually dim Trump's chances further.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It feels like unless something dramatic changes, this shooting might actually dim Trump's chances further.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But it is more likely that the shooting will benefit Trump. Barring a dramatic change, such as an open Democratic National Convention in August that produces a more dynamic presidential nominee than Biden, the partys electoral prospects have just become dimmer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's gonna be the only thing anyone talks about for months.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's gonna be the only thing anyone talks about for months.

artist_script:
People think an assassination attempt always helps a candidate, but actually it can totally backfire.
HostA: Taiwan's 2004 election is a perfect example of that. President Chen Shui-bian was shot the day before the vote.
HostB: Right, and he ended up losing by a landslide margin of 25 percent, which is just huge.
HostA: Exactly, and the sympathy wave people expected just didn't materialize—in fact, it seemed to work against him.
HostB: And then there was that investigation by Henry Lee, the forensic expert, which got really messy.
HostA: Yeah, he confirmed the injuries were real from an explosion, but then there was all this suspicion about the bomb's origin.
HostB: Which Taiwanese authorities kind of ignored, right? They just focused on the fact it was a real attack.
HostA: But then critics said it was staged to help Chen, even though the evidence didn't really support that.
HostB: So now with the Trump shooting, you've gotta wonder if we're seeing something similar play out.
HostA: I mean, the shooter’s been identified as a registered Democrat, but like, injured no one? It’s already fueling conspiracy theories everywhere.
HostB: And social media’s just flooded with claims—Russia, Al Qaeda, you name it.
HostA: But here’s the thing—Chen was leading in polls before he got shot, and then he lost. Trump was already trailing Biden in most polls.
HostB: So if there's a "Chen Shui-bian effect," it could really hurt Trump even more, especially with voters blaming him for political violence.
HostA: And then you've got these simple narratives taking over—"Biden is too old" versus "Trump took a bullet."
HostB: Whereas complex stuff, like economic policy, just doesn't cut through the noise as easily.
HostA: It feels like unless something dramatic changes, this shooting might actually dim Trump's chances further.
HostB: Yeah, it’s gonna be the only thing anyone talks about for months.
